content.description: Crux is betweent the 2nd and 3rd bolts, very beta intensive and balancy.
content.location: back side of big boulder located down from the main cliffline.

content.description: Climb arete on sparse pro.
content.location: At the end of Turtle Rock.

climbs.name: Turtle Soup
climbs.fa: Stan and Curtis Glass, Shannon Stegg, Gregg Allen.

content.description: Left side of slab. Boulder moves gets you to horns. Manuver out and over a roof to finish.
content.location: Right past Turtle Rock on slab.

content.description: A tougher version of Klingon. Technical crimpy slabby face climb with small holds. I wanted to give this bolted line a place here. If you have information about it please share, or try it and give suggestions. Beta: crux is between bolt three and four (bolt 1 is the rusty one that is shared with Klingon but you could stick clip the second bolt instead).
content.location: Shares same first rusty bolt with Klingon then veers right then straight up. These two routes are on a separate large white boulder slightly downhill just prior to the last overhang of turtle rock that contains Sloth. Following the main path, take the right fork when you see a large boulder (after a smaller but large boulder) in front with a smooth overhang and also the sloth overhang in the distant left on the main cliff line.

content.description: V6/7 crux off the ground, start on stacked rocks or hanging on rope. 12a to the top.
content.location: 150 feet past turtle's tail

content.description: Face climb that steps right to the upper section.
content.location: Keep walking past the brown looking wall that contains Lazy Anna, and you'll hit this set of bolts. The first bolt is on the juggy looking slab then it climbs up and over the lip of the roof at your back.

content.description:
This obscure route has a different feel from most of Sand Rock, with uniform hard sandstone instead of the more typical pebbly conglomerate.  Too bad it's so short. 

  Use stemming moves and the occasional substantial handhold to climb a right-facing dihedral to the top.
content.protection: Sparse; bring nuts and small cams.  Bolted anchors at the top.
content.location: Starts on the east end of a free-standing pinnacle in the woods about five minutes' walk past the end of the Turtle Rock section.

content.description: Slab climb with a roof and good headwall.
content.location: Starts with Spooky.

content.description: Climb a corner to a horn, Move to the right and over a roof and finish to the top.
content.location: About 10 ft. to the right of Turtle Soup.

content.description: First route on the left on the big boulder down from the main cliffline, past Turtle's Tail. Long, crimpy moves. May feel like a 12a.
content.location: just left of Twinkle Toes

content.description: A great, pumpy lead that will test your willpower!  Juggy holds and horns help to compensate for the lack of any rest stances for placing gear on the steadily overhanging conglomerate wall.  Just keep moving!  You'll want to be really solid at the grade before trying this one.
content.protection: Plentiful placements for medium gear, with some good horns to sling as well.  Save some bigger stuff for building an anchor at the top.
content.location: At the far east end of the Sun Wall; starts 20' right of Mobile Launcher.

content.description: Climb 20 feet of 5.10 fluff to a 20 foot section of V9/10.  I bolted it in Feb 2013 and gave this one serious session and can't figure out the sequence.  Maybe someone else can unlock it in the future.
content.location: Between Sloth and Access Denied

content.description:
Pumpy climbing on a pretty, overhanging arete.  Getting off the ground is the hardest part of this excellent climb, so stick-clipping is a good idea. 

  Finesse your way up a thin, pebbly face on the right side of the arete; if this is too much to handle, swallow your pride and stem onto the wall across the corridor from the arete.  Things get easier once you reach an undercling above the first bolt.  Continue up the steep arete to the top.
content.protection: Seven bolts; bolted anchors at the top.  NOTE:  if you're going to toprope this, keep draws on the last three bolts for directionals.  Otherwise, a fall will probably result in a nasty pendulum into the opposite wall of the corridor.
content.location: Starts around the corner about 30' right of Faith on an obvious arete.

content.description: Tricky sequence finishing on slab. Starts where brown and white rock faces meet.
content.location: The face/slab-top wall left of the overhang of Sloth. This is the right of the two 5.11's on this separate rock.

content.description: Tecnicle face climbing.
content.location: A large white boulder down the hill from Spooky. 10 ft. to the left of Cease Fire.

content.description: A nice crack climb that starts out fairly juggy and thins out toward the top; don't let the conglomerate rock shred your hands.
content.protection: Small to medium cams and passive pro; gear anchor at the top.
content.location: Located in the Turtle Rock section, far end of Sun Wall, about 20' right of Conglomernaut.

content.description:
The name says it all; like the other routes in this section, Conglomernaut is ready to shred your hands in its pebbly, conglomerated crack.  The strenuous start is fortunately well protected. 

  Using hand jams and stemming, pull through an overhung, right-leaning crack system; for an easier option, climb the right face on nice fins until you can move left to the crack.  Follow the crack to its end and continue on easier, juggy face climbing (with sparser protection) to the top.
content.protection: Small to medium gear (cams and passive pro); sling horns.  Gear anchor at the top.
content.location: Starts on the conglomerated wall between Pebble Power and Faith.  Walk off by jumping across to the main wall and go right to a descent trail.

content.description:
Your first thought as you look up at this seemingly-unprotectable line may be one of awe that someone actually made the first ascent on gear.  Your next thought will probably be something like "let's set up a toprope!"  It's worth noting that a retrobolt of Cease Fire was subsequently chopped. 

  The route follows an obvious shallow right-facing corner for most of its length.  Using crimpy laybacks and whatever holds you can find on the face, balance your way up the corner and then onto the left face about three-quarters of the way up.  Pull a bulge using lichen-covered slopers and crimpers to reach the top.
content.protection: Micronuts, tiny cams and nerves of steel should be all you really need.  Build a gear anchor at the top.  A toprope can easily be set up by scrambling to the top of the pinnacle from the east end.
content.location: Starts about 10' left of Shallow Stemming Corner.

content.description: 10 feet left of Toxic. Long move off the ground to a right crimp. Then some very balancy moves to a set of underclings. Out to a high right crimp. Then dyno to an 1/8 pad ear. Campus to a jug and up to the top.
content.location: Far end of Turtle Rock Area, 10 feet left of Toxic,   200 feet right of Turtle's Tail

content.description: Face climb with a blocky roof.
content.location: 20 ft. right of Sloth.

content.description: Past Sun Wall, you will come up on a very conglomerated cliff on the left, it will come to an abrupt end. This is Turtle's Tail.
